reviews.text: After reading all the positive reviews on this site, I thought I would have no problems. How wrong I was. I have been to Florida twice and can honestly say this is the worst hotel I have stayed in. We arrived on a Saturday and drove to the hotel. We got at front desk and was greeted by an ignorant women. When my husband politely said "hello" we just got a grunted reply of "name".
reviews.title: This Place Is Awful
Absolutely Brilliant
reviews.text: When we booked, we requested a non smoking room. She told us that the room was a smoking room, and when we told her that we booked a non smoking room, she replied "not my problem, ask your rep"!!

We thought this was very rude. So without an argument, we trudged up to our suite through a damp smelling corridor which was filled with bins full of rubbish. We discovered that the room 2 doors down were playing loud music. This was at 11:15!! We entered our suite to be greeted with damp smells, dirty carpets, unmade beds, unemptied bins, thread bare curtains hanging of the rail and when closed they had huge holes in them. The bathroom wasn’t much better. Mould on the tiles, broken shower head that was no more than a drizzle, leaking toilet, and the mirror was missing. We turned on the air conditioning to find it didn’t work. But because it was so late we decided to wait till the morning till we informed the front desk. We went to be at about 12am. It had been 20 minutes and the loud music was still playing. In the end my husband called front desk to tell them. It was the same woman as before and she just said the hotel policy was that music can be played until 01:30 hours at the weekends!! We told her we couldn’t sleep and she said there was nothing she could do about it and hung up on us!!
reviews.title: A Very Enjoyable Stay

reviews.text: We were kept awake till 1:45am and called front desk again and told her that the time limit was up and asked for someone to come up and tell them to turn the music down. She said she couldn’t as the hotel security was on vacation and that she or other members of staff couldn’t because it was “hotel policy”. It seemed she liked saying that. We eventually got to sleep but were woken by someone banging on our door at 6:30am. It was a maid wanting to clean our room!! I said we are still in bed and she practically ordered us to be out the room by 7:30!!! We couldn’t believe the attitude. We decided to go to Magic Kingdom and take advantage of the free Disney transport. We went to front desk and, yes you guessed it, greeted by the same receptionist as before. We asked for the free coach and she informed us that the free shuttle was only available on certain days and that today we would have to pay!! We were disgusted. It is what I would call false advertisement. So off we went to the theme park and before we left we asked for maintenance to fix the leaky toilet and the air conditioner. We got back and found the toilet NOT fixed and neither had the air conditioner!!
reviews.title: Providing Added Value
Wonderful!
reviews.text: Again called front desk who told us maintenance only worked nine till six!! We also discovered the room HADN’T been cleaned by the maid who had made us exit our room to clean it. So at this point we were getting annoyed. We have: Ignorant staff, dirty rooms, loud music, woken up by the maids, poor service and basically being ripped off. The next incident took place 5 days later. We got back from the theme park to discover a watch of my husband’s had gone missing. We reported it to front desk who said in so many words nothing could be done and blamed us by saying we had mislaid it!! We decided to move hotels but were told we couldn’t by our rep. We put up with this dire place for the rest of the holiday. During this time rooms were not cleaned well or simply not cleaned at all, the broken electrical things were never fixed or replaced, loud music and noise went on till all hours with nothing being done. And to add insult to injury on the last day, we went to get our deposit back and were told we couldn’t have it because of the maintenance work that had been done on our room!!!! Not only had NO work been done but should WE pay for that anyway??!!?!
Loved having a huge clean fridge and ice maker. Good dinner buffet. Very responsive staff.
reviews.title: Came for work, but enjoyed family time as well

reviews.text: Let me preface the review that something was going on at the Convention center as well as the Daytona 500 was the coming weekend. The hotel was CRAZY busy, and the staff was unable to keep up. I travel for business a lot and was coming from Tampa after my meetings, I arrived about an hour early and was denied check in, even though I'm a Hilton Rewards member. Annoying, and forced me to drive around I-drive making phone calls and keeping busy until their 4 pm check-in. Once I returned everything was fine, but agent forgot to redeem my special rate promotion and I needed to go back to ask. SHe did apologize, but I'm glad I remembered to ask!! Breakfast was just OK, I think sue to the large amount of people and I skipped the receptions all together, once again due to the large amount of people. The rooms were OK, and nice amenities, however the desk is located immediately next to the door. Poor design and found I wasn't comfortable using it. I did find the exercise room adequate, but overall I think the hotel was overwhelmed with the number of travelers. Don't think I'll be back and I'll try to find a hotel better suited to the solo business traveler.
reviews.title: Just OK for business

reviews.text: Stayed here for a three-night business trip. The room was comfortable, albeit a little worn down, and had a full kitchen. Check what your view will be because outside my windows sat the air conditioner units and a wall. Free breakfast every morning was satisfactory. The usual eggs, sausage, and fruit. The front desk is a little slow. During my stay the three times I had to go to the desk there was always a very long line (even one time at 10:00pm) and they didn't seem to move very quickly. Hotel was clean and employees were very friendly though.
reviews.title: Workable hotel in a good location

reviews.text: There are restaurants and bars within walking distance of the hotel, although if you are going to the theme parks I recommend being closer to them (such as staying on property). But, this hotel would work for Universal or Sea World trips, especially for the price.
reviews.title: I think this is a really well run hotel.

reviews.text: Overall, if you are in town for a few days and need a good place to stay this will do it.
reviews.title: Great service & location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at Homewood Suites March 1st to the 10th.For the money we paid,it was one of the best hotels I have stayed at.
reviews.title: Excellent choice

reviews.text: Good free breakfast daily,light meal with free beer and wine from 5 to 7 pm Mon to Thurs.Two large plasma tvs in each suite,with a very good choice of channels.Room was spotless,and house keeping very good.All the staff I met were very helpful and friendly,especially management,and reception staff.
reviews.title: friendly staff, nice rooms

reviews.text: Overall, very nice stay. Rooms were clean and spacious. Complimentary breakfast was well stocked and generous. Only disappointment is the pool area. 99% of the pool area is shaded during the afternoon hours, when I go to florida I want some sun.. We were encouraged to use neighboring hotel pool but it was pretty small. Nice hotel in a great location.
reviews.title: Great value vs. convention center hotels

reviews.text: My group stayed at the Homewood Suites in late February 2009. We chose this hotel over the other hotels offered by our convention that were in walking distance to the convention center. Although we had a choice of taking our convention center scheduled shuttle or the local I-trolley we found it better to be closer to the restaurants and enteraintment. Those staying at the convention center hotels had to walk or take taxis to us and the restaurants.
reviews.title: Great Stay! Homewood is the best!

reviews.text: This hotel was nearly full every night we were there, but the staff did a great job at the breakfast time and evening social hour keeping food and drinks supplied.
reviews.title: brilliant

reviews.text: We stayed at the Homewood Suites late Oct 2005 and enjoyed everything about the hotel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a handy location
Clean and Great Breakfast
reviews.text: The staff were extremely helpful. The rooms were spacious/clean with a separate bedroom and living room - there was also complimentary wireless internet access. The hot breakfast was incredible and very popular with all guests – you have the option of eating in the dining area or taking the food back to your room. The location on International Drive is close to a number of major attractions and plenty of good shopping centres and factory outlets.

reviews.title: The Best Hotel In Orlando
reviews.text: Must also mention that the management were excellent at keeping the guests up to date with any activities relating to Hurricane Wilma.

reviews.title: pleasure was all ours
reviews.text: Overall very good value for money and we would highly recommend the Homewood Suites to anyone.
Great breakfast. Different hot dishes each day with staff constantly cleaning up and refueling.
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.text: I stayed at the Homewood Suites, International Drive in May and also in February while visiting my daughter who has been working for Walt Disney World and the staff continue to give excellent friendly service. Good breakfast selection and the evening snacks and drinks are a welcome bonus. Suites are comfortable with fridge, dishwasher, microwave, 2 T.V's, sofa bed and separate bedroom. Trolley stop is nearby so you can get to the attractions easily and tickets for the trolley and attractions are sold in the lobby. The business centre has free use of the computers and printer, handy for printing boarding cards and checking e,mails. Plenty of good restaurants nearby. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to friends and family .
reviews.title: Great stay.

reviews.text: Great hotel, friendly and helpful staff (Luis & Orianna thks), spotlessly clean (maid service was excellent), great location in International Drive especially if you don't want to rent a car. Breakfast included, porridge, cereal, eggs (boiled, omelette or scrambled - varies), fruit (apple, pear, grapefruit, orange grapes), juices, breads (toast, bagle, muffin, danish), make your own waffles (add cream / chocolate). Managers welcome home meal / snack buffet(depending on your appetite) Mon - Thurs, this often sufficed as dinner for us - especially if we were too tired to go out for dinner. Pool area spotless, plenty of loungers and towels. Had 1bed suite, very spacious, just as photos on website. Free wireless internet, many hotels charge $10 per day for this. I recommend Friendly's restaurant across the road for good value food.
reviews.title: Excellent - we'll be back

reviews.text: I have to say that this Hotel has always maintained its high level of excellent service and has not changed in anyway to my last visit. The Reception was always welcoming and helpfull the staff are always ready to help with a genuine smile should you need any assistance, I can say with all honesty that I thank the Manager and his team for a wonderful stay again at the Homewood Suites, the welcome home evenings with a free buffet with wine and beer on monday to thursday was a nice ending to a tiring day at the parks, breakfast served hot dishes if desired always set us up well for the day ahead.
reviews.title: NEVER FAILING WITH EXCELLENT SERVICE.

reviews.text: This Hotel is well placed in international drive for all the attractions, with everything in easy reach shops etc.
reviews.title: What a perfect family hotel! Service was outstanding! We LOVED it!

reviews.text: We were looking for a clean, somewhat new or newly renovated family oriented hotel, with a good breakfast included, but most importantly a location close to Universal. Well we were VERY pleasantly surprised. We got everything we were hoping for and more. I have never stayed in a hotel that had staff this friendly and caring! They made us feel very welcome after a very long journey. The desk clerk even gave the kids free game coins for the arcade to keep them busy while we checked in...nice thoughtful gesture that was much appreciated. The hot breakfast buffet was a definite plus and we enjoyed the evening buffets (Mon-Thurs) on occasion, too (not a huge variety, but cold beer, soda, and wine were included so who could complain!). Overall the location was minutes away from Universal, the pool & hot-tub were great, the room/suite was clean and comfortable (and large)....it was perfect for us in every way and we'll definately be back!
reviews.title: Great Rooms, wonderful service!
Great Spot in Orlando
reviews.text: The Homewood Suites on International Drive in Orlando is great for families. Excellent service, clean rooms, free breakfast and snacks and an ideal location.

reviews.title: Great Hotel & Location
reviews.text: Booked holiday through TravelCityDirect and were not disappointed! Arrived late at hotel as plane delayed, great welcome by hotel staff, very welcoming. Was well impressed with room - large living area & bedroom with very large bed. Room was cleaned on a daily basis. If returning to Orlando we would definately stay here again great value for money.

reviews.title: brilliant hotel
reviews.text: stayed at the homewood suites june 11-25.Read all the positive reviews and booked through travelcity direct, we were not dissapointed hotel is a gem rooms spacious and clean and the staff so friendly and canot do enough for you.It realy is a home from home thats how it feels. free breakfast was good and free food and drink monday-thursday if you are around for it which we never were.Its on the best side of international drive,near wonderworks so its quiet so no trouble sleeping.would stay here agian, and recomend it highly.
We went here( June 8 thro 11) after reading previous Trip Advisor reports and were not disappointed.
reviews.title: Couldn't fault the place!!!
Pretty Good Place --- Very Convenient
reviews.text: All staff very polite, helpful and friendly

Typical busy Orlando hotel for families. Rooms not big, but ok; well furnished with cookers, toaster, fridge, plates, glasses, etc. Was noisy at times, but that's not the fault of the hotel. Free internet was great, plus free breakfast, and light evening meal Mon-Thu. Not enough elevators at peak times. Ideal location for the parks and for evening restaurants.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Brilliant hotel. Short walk to Pointe Orlando shopping / eating mall. Friendly staff, good breakfast in the morning. A suite for $130? Where else would you get it. We have travelled across all of Florida in the last two weeks and cannot get close to the service and value of this place. Couldn't recommend this place highly enough.
reviews.title: Excellent - an absolute bargain

reviews.text: Stayed for a weekend getaway to Sea World with My husband and 20 month old. Great location for Sea World- less than a 5 min drive. Room was clean. Some of the furniture had some markings and small rips on it- but nothing outrageous. Could hear some noise from the room next door- and from loud folks in the parking lot- but nothing into the wee hours of the morning. Breakfast was great! Lots of options and kept very clean- even though there was a Mary Kay convevntion going on and the place was packed. Not a good pool for little ones though- barely a deck at all. Staff was great. We will definetly go back again.
reviews.title: Great stay- will return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't have a bad word to say about this hotel. The rooms were immaculate and generously sized. The breakfast was superb and the shuttle service to the Disney and Universal parks was reliable, comfortable and safe.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: The reception staff were very friendly and helpful as were the shuttle drivers etc. The location was perfect with a number of shops, restaurants and amenities a short walk away on International Drive. Although the hotel is situated on International drive, it is set back from the main road and is quiet and peaceful as a result.
reviews.title: Absoloutely Fantastic hotel!

reviews.text: Hotel was close to convention center and even closer to nightlife hot spots like Howl at the Moon. Great resteraunts nearby. Breakfast menu was very good and full of options. Room was clean and very comfortable. I will be back in a month.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay, great location and will be back soon

reviews.text: I stayed at the HomeWood Suites for business last week. I was impressed with the location off from the main stretch of International Drive. It seemed quiet and was within walking distance of a quite a few restaurants and a couple of stores.
reviews.title: Great Service and Location!

reviews.text: The Lobby is nice and the people at the desk are personable. There was only one woman that I recall appearing a little frazzled. I actually asked her to call me a cab to go and workout at the Gold's Gym (1.9mi away) and she directed me to a black car outside the hotel. I truly thought nothing of it until I got in and the driver had no clue where the club was! Thank goodness for my iPhone! Oh, plus the cost for that short trip was $14, even after I asked him if it was extra for the added time it took to find it.
reviews.title: Dirty and ran down

reviews.text: So, back to the hotel. I liked my room as it had an open concept 1 bedroom with the kitchenette and the livingroom as you walk in. It leads to a nice king sized bed and the sink over to my left. Then the bathroom which was rather large!
reviews.title: Great Customer Service

reviews.text: The service was superb! They did the few dishes that I had in the sink the whole week. There was never an issue finding your way around the hotel if you just asked. There was a gentleman that I saw at the front desk area (looked like a manager) who was extremely helpful each time I needed something.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent the last night of our Orlando holiday here on International Drive on 14 March. Got a great deal through the hotel's own website - booking all very easyand straight-forward.
reviews.title: Fantastic Staff - Fantastic Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As we arrived at the hotel at 1.30 (check in not until 4.00p.m.) asked at reception if there was any chance of an early check-in. Extremely pleasant and helpful receptionist who advised our room was actually ready and we could check in immediately.
reviews.title: SIMPLY AMAZING!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got bags from car and back to check-in. Checked in by Gary (Assistant Manager) who told us lots about the hotel, about complimentary evening meal and wine and full breakfast in the morning. We were onlly staying one night but made to feel like honoured guests. Also asked how much it would cost for a late checkout next day as flight home not until 7.30 p.m. He checked his computer and for no extra charge allowed us to stay in our room until 2.00 p.m. - what service.
reviews.title: Unbelievable Service! Excellent Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Allocated Room 333 (on third floor but ground level is considered first floor). Room spotlessly clean, with small kitchen area, full fridge, small cooker, kettle, microwave, complimentary tea and fantastic coffee and lounge area wtih window overlooking pool, which led through to the bedroom, again with large window overlooking the pool with huge big bed, and ensuite bathroom.
reviews.title: Perfect location for everything and the staff really make the stay special

reviews.text: We have been lucky enough to have stayed in the past at The Wynn, Las Vegas and the Fairmont, San Francisco and the bed at Homewood Suites gave them both a run for their money - and for an amazing price!!!
reviews.title: My reservation meant nothing

reviews.text: The hotel rooms are very good and have everything you could need. There is a large fridge freezer, two electric rings, a dishwasher, toaster and all the crockery etc. There is a table and four chairs. There is a hairdyer, an iron and ironing board and a safe (there is a small charge for the safe). The bed is big and comfortable and there is a comfortable pull out sofa bed in the lounge which we also used. There are two tv's, one in the lounge area and one in the bedroom. On the day we were leaving they were upgrading at the tv's to flatscreens. The rooms are cleaned and towels changed daily.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Location

likes.liked: — The rooms had everything you could want in a great location
likes.disliked: — I couldn't fault the hotel. Maybe a bar would be an asset?

reviews.text: There is a free breakfast buffet everyday and although not amazing it is very reasonable. They supplied sausages, diced fried potato and scrambled egg, toast, cereals, some basic fruit, cakes and pastries, and you could make your own waffles.
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.text: There is a welcome home reception Monday to Thursday from 5.00pm to 7.00pm. They have free beer and wine, and a different food each night. ie hotdogs, macaroni cheese, chicken and rice plus snacks and salad. We didn't really eat the food but did manage a few of the drinks. There is no bar or restaurant in the hotel and room service is supplied by TGI Fridays or other takeaways.
reviews.title: Welcome to Homewood!

likes.liked: — The ultra-low price, the location, the separate room, the included food.
likes.disliked: — No place to put a towel by the sink, lack of variety of breakfast meats, no fresh baked cookies.

reviews.text: There are two laundry rooms, one on the 5th and one on the 6th floor.
reviews.title: Terrific hotel with a premium on service
Great location for family adventure!
reviews.text: The hotel is in a good location between the red and the green line of the I-Trolley. These are very good and run at least every 20mins from one end of IDrive to the other. There are plenty of restaurants in walking distance and just up the road is Pointe Orlando which is very good. There are bars, shops and restaruants, we saw a couple of live bands. There is also a jazz club.

reviews.title: Superb Hotel & Location
reviews.text: Stayed at the Homewood for 2wks 24 Sep - 8 Oct. The hotel is homely, friendly and immaculate and we are very fussy about cleanliness. We had a one bed suite and really could not fault it. Maid was in every day with clean towels, shampoo, body lotion etc.

Even though you have full kitchen facilities there's a complimentary breakfast with hot & cold food every morning & the managers buffet with free wine & beer Mon - Thu really is an added bonus. You can even take as much of it to your room and come back for more if you wish and if you read about anyone complaining that there's not enough choice IT'S COMPLIMENTARY!! Check out the buffet first with a few free drinks and eat elsewhere if nothing takes your fancy.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.text: We had a great holiday and would certainly stay at the Homewood again.
reviews.title: Homewood Suites Intl Drive - quite alright !

reviews.text: Stayed a week at this hotel (15 - 22 September) and from walking in the door the staff couldn't do enough for you. Arrived late in the evening and were given a smoking room, when we went back to the desk this was instantly changed by the Night Manager. The next day he even asked if there was anything else he could help us with. The breakfasts were of a high standard and was hot and plentiful and the place was kept exceptionally clean. The rooms were also cleaned to a high standard. The only down side was that the pool was being renovated (due to open again on the 26th September), but we were told that we could have the use of the hotels next door, just across the car park, which we did, or to another one of the same chain. This hotel is in an ideal position - on I-Drive but set well back from the road so it is very quiet. Would definitely go back.
reviews.title: Fantastic value and location

reviews.text: We stayed at the Homewood Suites at the end of Aug 2005. I am a little fussy about the type of place I stay in and this Hotel really was OK. We are a family of 4 and didn't fancy having to sleep on the sofabed. After asking reception they kindly upgraded us to a twin double bed suite at no extra cost.
reviews.title: Superb hotel

reviews.text: stayed here at christmas, great hotel the staff are very friendly and helpfull, the welcome home drink and food is a great idea, the hotel also offers free travel to both the disney and universal parks, would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here Feb 2008 for two weeks, great hotel, great staff, the free breakfast is a excellent and so is the free beers ,wine and food during the week!!.
reviews.title: Loved Homewood Suites

reviews.text: You can get to all the parks via free transport providing you book and there's lots on your door step. The hotel has only one down side, the pool, I stayed at the Holiday Inn on Int drive many years ago at that had a fantastic pool wereas this one is in the centre of the hotel and has limited area around the pool and is very over shaddowed by the building.
reviews.title: Superb Stay

reviews.text: If your looking for a great hotel as a base for all the parks then this hotel is it, if your looking for a few days by the pool too then maybe this isnt the hotel for you.
reviews.title: Family friendly

reviews.text: had a wonderfull stay , helpfull front desk always pleasant, mario the manager could not do enough for you he was a pleasure to deal with a gentleman ,suite was clean a great size and good maid service,the transport to the parks saves a small fortune,breakfast has everything you cold ask for,get there early though as is very popular,happy hour is free alcoholic drinks or juice and a snack- great wee filler before dinner,good little gym,good laundry facilities,basically a very good option for stay in orlando just off int drive about midway between disney and universal definately stay here again, and have to finish with a big thank-you to mario for everything top bloke. from the hughes family scotland cheers mate
reviews.title: Wonderful!

likes.liked: — The kitchen with everything and the bed
